title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 1 Chronicles chapter 11 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 1 Chronicles Chapter 11.

questions.question: Where did all Israel gather to anoint David as king?
options: Hebron
Jerusalem
Bethlehem
Jebus
questions.correctAnswer: Hebron
questions.explanation: All Israel gathered to David at Hebron and anointed him king over Israel (1 Chronicles 11:1-3).

questions.question: Who led the attack that made him chief and captain during the conquest of Jebus?
options: Joab
Abishai
Benaiah
Eleazar
questions.correctAnswer: Joab
questions.explanation: Joab went first up and was chief after smiting the Jebusites (1 Chronicles 11:6).

questions.question: What was the city of Jerusalem called in David's time?
options: Jebus
Hebron
Bethlehem
Zion
questions.correctAnswer: Jebus
questions.explanation: Jerusalem was called Jebus, inhabited by the Jebusites (1 Chronicles 11:4).

questions.question: What did David call the fortress he lived in after taking it?
options: The city of David
The castle of Zion
The city of Hebron
The stronghold of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: The city of David
questions.explanation: David dwelt in the castle, which was then called the city of David (1 Chronicles 11:7).

questions.question: Who was the chief of the captains that killed three hundred men with his spear at one time?
options: Jashobeam
Eleazar
Abishai
Benaiah
questions.correctAnswer: Jashobeam
questions.explanation: Jashobeam, an Hachmonite, lifted up his spear against three hundred slain by him at one time (1 Chronicles 11:11).

questions.question: At which location did Eleazar stand his ground and defeat the Philistines?
options: Pasdammim
Bethlehem
Hebron
Jebus
questions.correctAnswer: Pasdammim
questions.explanation: Eleazar was with David at Pasdammim where he and the people fought the Philistines (1 Chronicles 11:13-14).

questions.question: What did David ask for from the well of Bethlehem?
options: Water to drink
Bread for the army
Wine for celebration
Oil for anointing
questions.correctAnswer: Water to drink
questions.explanation: David longed for water from the well of Bethlehem by the gate (1 Chronicles 11:17).

questions.question: How did David respond to the water brought by the three mighty men?
options: He poured it out to the LORD
He drank it eagerly
He gave it to his soldiers
He saved it for later
questions.correctAnswer: He poured it out to the LORD
questions.explanation: David poured out the water as an offering to the LORD, refusing to drink it because it was brought at great risk (1 Chronicles 11:18-19).

questions.question: Who was the captain of the three mighty men known for killing three hundred men?
options: Abishai
Joab
Benaiah
Eleazar
questions.correctAnswer: Abishai
questions.explanation: Abishai was the chief of the three mighty men who killed three hundred men and had a name among them (1 Chronicles 11:20-21).

questions.question: Which mighty man slew two lionlike men of Moab and a lion in a pit on a snowy day?
options: Benaiah
Jashobeam
Eleazar
Abishai
questions.correctAnswer: Benaiah
questions.explanation: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada performed these acts of valor (1 Chronicles 11:22).

questions.question: True or False: David was anointed king according to the word of the LORD by Samuel.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: David was anointed king over Israel according to the word of the LORD by Samuel (1 Chronicles 11:3).

questions.question: True or False: The inhabitants of Jebus welcomed David peacefully.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The inhabitants of Jebus said to David, 'Thou shalt not come hither,' but David took the castle of Zion by force (1 Chronicles 11:5).

questions.question: True or False: Joab was the brother of Abishai.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Abishai is identified as the brother of Joab (1 Chronicles 11:20).

questions.question: Complete the verse from 1 Chronicles 11:9: 'So David waxed greater and greater: for the LORD of hosts was ______.'
options: with him
against him
pleased with him
silent towards him
questions.correctAnswer: with him
questions.explanation: The verse states that David waxed greater because the LORD of hosts was with him (1 Chronicles 11:9).

questions.question: Complete the verse from 1 Chronicles 11:18: 'And the three brake through the host of the Philistines, and drew water out of the well of Bethlehem, that was by the gate, and took it, and brought it to David: but David would not drink of it, but ______.'
options: poured it out to the LORD
saved it for later
gave it to his men
threw it on the ground
questions.correctAnswer: poured it out to the LORD
questions.explanation: David poured out the water as an offering to the LORD instead of drinking it (1 Chronicles 11:18).

medium.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with leadership responsibilities and fears failure. Based on 1 Chronicles 11, what biblical truth about leadership would you share?
options: God equips and strengthens those He calls to lead.
Leadership depends mainly on personal strength and wisdom.
Leaders should rely on political alliances to succeed.
Success in leadership comes from avoiding conflict.
questions.correctAnswer: God equips and strengthens those He calls to lead.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 11:9 states that David grew greater and greater because the LORD of hosts was with him. Verses 1-3 show God’s sovereign choice of David as king, emphasizing dependence on God rather than personal ability.

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 11 teach us about humility in leadership through David's response to the water brought by his mighty men?
options: David refused to drink the water because he saw their sacrifice as sacred.
David proudly drank the water to honor their bravery.
David distributed the water among all his soldiers.
David ignored the water and focused on battle plans.
questions.correctAnswer: David refused to drink the water because he saw their sacrifice as sacred.
questions.explanation: Verses 17-19 show David’s humility and reverence for the risk his men took. He poured out the water as an offering to God, recognizing their lives were jeopardized, teaching us humility and honoring sacrifice.

questions.question: A believer feels overwhelmed by challenges and doubts God’s presence. What encouragement about God's faithfulness can you share from 1 Chronicles 11?
options: God is with us and grants increasing strength and success.
God only helps those who are perfect and sinless.
Success comes only from human effort and strategy.
Difficulties mean God has abandoned us.
questions.correctAnswer: God is with us and grants increasing strength and success.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 11:9 affirms that David waxed greater because the LORD of hosts was with him, showing God’s faithfulness to those who trust Him even in trials.

questions.question: What does David’s covenant with the elders in Hebron teach about commitment and unity in the church?
options: Unity and covenant before the LORD strengthen communal leadership.
Covenants are unnecessary if personal goals are clear.
Only kings need to make covenants for success.
Unity depends on compromise with worldly powers.
questions.correctAnswer: Unity and covenant before the LORD strengthen communal leadership.
questions.explanation: Verses 3 shows David making a covenant with Israel’s elders before the LORD, highlighting the importance of spiritual unity and commitment in leadership and church life.

questions.question: According to 1 Chronicles 11, how should believers respond when faced with opposition or discouragement?
options: Trust in God’s power and courageously take action.
Avoid confrontation and wait for easier circumstances.
Rely solely on human wisdom to overcome obstacles.
Give up and seek comfort elsewhere.
questions.correctAnswer: Trust in God’s power and courageously take action.
questions.explanation: David’s taking of the Jebusite fortress (verses 4-7) despite opposition shows trusting God courageously. Joab’s leadership in battle (verse 6) exemplifies bold action relying on God’s strength.

questions.question: What does the example of David’s mighty men teach about perseverance and faith in God during spiritual challenges?
options: Faithful perseverance leads to victory through God’s help.
Only the strongest survive spiritual battles.
Victory depends on personal popularity.
Spiritual challenges should be avoided.
questions.correctAnswer: Faithful perseverance leads to victory through God’s help.
questions.explanation: Verses 10-14 describe mighty men who trusted God and fought bravely, resulting in great deliverance. Their faith and perseverance exemplify reliance on God in trials.

questions.question: A believer wants to cultivate integrity in their daily work. What lesson from the lives of David’s warriors can you share?
options: Excellence and faithfulness in small tasks honor God and build trust.
Only lofty achievements matter, not daily integrity.
Integrity is less important than winning at any cost.
Work ethic should be flexible depending on circumstances.
questions.correctAnswer: Excellence and faithfulness in small tasks honor God and build trust.
questions.explanation: David’s mighty men demonstrated valor and faithfulness repeatedly (verses 11-25), showing consistent dedication and integrity as key to their honored status.

questions.question: True or False: David accepted the water brought by his men without hesitation as a symbol of their bravery.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: David refused to drink the water (verses 17-19) because he considered drinking it as drinking the blood of the men who risked their lives, showing respect and humility.

questions.question: True or False: The chapter highlights that God’s presence was the key factor in David’s growing success as king.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 9 directly states that David waxed greater because the LORD of hosts was with him, emphasizing God’s presence as the key to success.

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 11:1 illustrate the importance of fellowship and unity among believers?
options: Believers are called to be united as one body, closely connected like 'bone and flesh'.
Believers should maintain independence and avoid close ties.
Unity is less important than individual achievements.
Fellowship should be limited to family members only.
questions.correctAnswer: Believers are called to be united as one body, closely connected like 'bone and flesh'.
questions.explanation: Verse 1 shows Israel declaring to David, 'we are thy bone and thy flesh,' symbolizing deep unity and fellowship in the community of faith.

questions.question: In what way does David’s taking of the city of Jerusalem demonstrate faith and boldness in serving God’s purposes?
options: David acted with confidence in God’s promise despite opposition.
David waited for the Jebusites to surrender peacefully.
David avoided conflict by choosing another city.
David negotiated a treaty to avoid battle.
questions.correctAnswer: David acted with confidence in God’s promise despite opposition.
questions.explanation: Verses 4-7 describe how David took the Jebusite fortress despite their defiance, showing bold faith to accomplish God’s plan.

questions.question: What practical lesson on gratitude and reverence toward God can be drawn from David’s actions after receiving the water from his men?
options: Offerings of gratitude to God honor the sacrifices made by others.
Gratitude is not necessary if a gift is received.
Reverence is only for grand events, not small acts.
One should keep blessings for personal enjoyment only.
questions.correctAnswer: Offerings of gratitude to God honor the sacrifices made by others.
questions.explanation: David poured out the water to the LORD as an offering (verse 18), showing reverence and gratitude for the sacrifice of his men.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to 1 Chronicles 11:6, Joab became the chief and captain because he ________.
options: was the first to smite the Jebusites
was the oldest among David’s men
negotiated peace with the Jebusites
built the city walls of Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: was the first to smite the Jebusites
questions.explanation: Verse 6 states that David said whoever smote the Jebusites first would be chief and captain, and Joab went first and became chief.

questions.question: How does the example of David’s mighty men, who faced great dangers and fought valiantly, encourage believers today in dealing with temptation and trials?
options: God honors those who bravely confront spiritual battles with faith.
Avoiding temptation is impossible and shows weakness.
Only physical strength can overcome trials.
Trials should be ignored to maintain peace.
questions.correctAnswer: God honors those who bravely confront spiritual battles with faith.
questions.explanation: The mighty men’s courageous acts (verses 11-25) demonstrate that facing challenges with trust in God leads to victory and honor.

questions.question: What does the anointing of David as king before the LORD teach about the importance of obedience and divine approval in leadership?
options: True leadership requires covenant and anointing according to God's word.
Leadership is based on human choice without divine input.
Anointing is only symbolic and not essential for leadership.
Divine approval is unnecessary if people support the leader.
questions.correctAnswer: True leadership requires covenant and anointing according to God's word.
questions.explanation: Verse 3 shows David was anointed king before the LORD in accordance with Samuel’s word, emphasizing obedience and divine approval.

hard.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 1 Chronicles Chapter 11.

questions.question: What declaration did all Israel make to David when they gathered in Hebron?
options: Behold, we are thy bone and thy flesh
We anoint you as a prophet
You shall be our priest forever
The Lord has forsaken Saul
questions.correctAnswer: Behold, we are thy bone and thy flesh
questions.explanation: In 1 Chronicles 11:1, all Israel declares to David, 'Behold, we are thy bone and thy flesh,' emphasizing their kinship and unity with David.

questions.question: According to 1 Chronicles 11:2, what did the LORD command David to do for Israel?
options: Feed my people Israel and be their ruler
Build a temple for the LORD
Lead the tribes to battle against the Philistines
Establish a covenant with Saul's descendants
questions.correctAnswer: Feed my people Israel and be their ruler
questions.explanation: Verse 2 states that the LORD told David he shall feed His people Israel and be their ruler, highlighting David’s divinely ordained kingship.

questions.question: Where was David anointed king over Israel according to this chapter?
options: Hebron
Jerusalem
Bethlehem
Gibeah
questions.correctAnswer: Hebron
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 11:3 explains that David was anointed king over Israel in Hebron before the LORD and the elders of Israel.

questions.question: The city of Jerusalem was known as what when David first went there?
options: Jebus
Zion
Bethlehem
Hebron
questions.correctAnswer: Jebus
questions.explanation: Verse 4 identifies Jerusalem as Jebus, the city inhabited by the Jebusites before David's conquest.

questions.question: Who was the first to enter the castle of Zion and thus became chief and captain?
options: Joab the son of Zeruiah
Abishai the brother of Joab
Benaiah the son of Jehoiada
Eleazar the son of Dodo
questions.correctAnswer: Joab the son of Zeruiah
questions.explanation: Verse 6 relates that David declared whoever struck first would be chief, and Joab, son of Zeruiah, went up first and became chief.

questions.question: What is the significance of the name 'City of David' as mentioned in this chapter?
options: It was the castle where David dwelt after capturing Zion
It was the name of David's birthplace
It was the name of the temple David built
It was the capital city of Saul
questions.correctAnswer: It was the castle where David dwelt after capturing Zion
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 11:7 states that David dwelt in the castle, which was then called the city of David, marking the establishment of his royal seat.

questions.question: Which stronghold or area is mentioned as being built up around the city of David?
options: Millo
Gibeah
Zion
Bethlehem
questions.correctAnswer: Millo
questions.explanation: Verse 8 tells that David built the city around Millo, an important fortified area, with Joab repairing the rest of the city.

questions.question: How does the phrase 'David waxed greater and greater' in 1 Chronicles 11:9 reflect a theological theme in the biblical narrative?
options: It emphasizes divine favor and the LORD's presence with the king
It indicates David's growing wealth through trade
It shows David's military conquests without divine intervention
It references David's personal ambition and self-reliance
questions.correctAnswer: It emphasizes divine favor and the LORD's presence with the king
questions.explanation: The verse indicates David's increasing greatness is due to 'the LORD of hosts' being with him, emphasizing divine support rather than mere human effort.

questions.question: Who was Jashobeam and what was his notable feat according to 1 Chronicles 11:11?
options: Chief of the captains who killed 300 men in one encounter
David's priest who anointed him king
The Jebusite leader defeated by Joab
A Philistine giant slain by Benaiah
questions.correctAnswer: Chief of the captains who killed 300 men in one encounter
questions.explanation: Verse 11 identifies Jashobeam as the chief captain who lifted his spear against 300 men slain at one time, underscoring his might.

questions.question: What does Eleazar’s defense of the barley field in 1 Chronicles 11:13-14 symbolize in the broader biblical narrative?
options: Faithful endurance and divine deliverance in the face of overwhelming odds
The establishment of agricultural laws in Israel
David’s military strategy against the Philistines
The beginning of the wheat harvest season
questions.correctAnswer: Faithful endurance and divine deliverance in the face of overwhelming odds
questions.explanation: Eleazar’s stand in a field full of barley and the LORD’s great deliverance (verses 13-14) symbolize reliance on God’s power rather than human strength.

questions.question: What act of loyalty did the three mighty men perform for David in the cave of Adullam according to 1 Chronicles 11:15-18?
options: They risked their lives to bring water from Bethlehem's well
They anointed David as king in secret
They defeated the Jebusites alone
They hid David from Saul’s soldiers
questions.correctAnswer: They risked their lives to bring water from Bethlehem's well
questions.explanation: Verses 15-18 describe how three of the thirty broke through the Philistine host to get water for David, demonstrating their devotion and bravery.

questions.question: Why did David refuse to drink the water brought by his three mighty men, as explained in 1 Chronicles 11:19?
options: Because it would be like drinking the blood of those who risked their lives
Because he did not trust its purity
Because he was fasting for the LORD
Because the water was from enemy territory
questions.correctAnswer: Because it would be like drinking the blood of those who risked their lives
questions.explanation: David poured out the water to the LORD, saying it would be wrong to drink water bought at the price of his men’s lives (verse 19).

questions.question: Which of the following best describes Benaiah’s feats as recorded in 1 Chronicles 11:22-23?
options: Slaying two lionlike men of Moab, a lion in a pit, and a giant Egyptian
Leading the charge against the Jebusites
Anointing David as king
Capturing the city of Jebus
questions.correctAnswer: Slaying two lionlike men of Moab, a lion in a pit, and a giant Egyptian
questions.explanation: Verses 22-23 detail Benaiah’s remarkable feats, including killing dangerous men and a giant, demonstrating his valor.

questions.question: What role was Benaiah given by David despite not being among the first three mighty men?
options: Set over David’s guard
Commander of the entire army
Chief priest
Governor of Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: Set over David’s guard
questions.explanation: Verse 25 shows David appointed Benaiah over his guard, indicating a position of trust and authority.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Chronicles 11, Joab’s brother Abishai was known for slaying three hundred men with his spear and was more honorable than the other two of the first three mighty men.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verses 20-21 affirm Abishai killed three hundred men and was considered more honorable than the other two in the first three mighty men.

theological.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 1 Chronicles Chapter 11 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What significant theological truth about God's sovereign appointment is emphasized when Israel anointed David king in Hebron?
options: David was anointed king according to the word of the LORD by Samuel
David declared himself king without divine approval
Saul continued to reign alongside David
David immediately conquered all Israelite enemies
questions.correctAnswer: David was anointed king according to the word of the LORD by Samuel
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 11:3 states that David was anointed king according to the word of the LORD by Samuel, affirming divine sovereignty in kingship, consistent with God's election seen in 1 Samuel 16:1-13, Psalm 2:6, Isaiah 55:11, and Acts 13:22.

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 11 characterize Israel's relationship with David, reflecting the doctrine of covenant community?
options: They said, 'Behold, we are thy bone and thy flesh'
They ignored David's claim to leadership
They demanded Saul remain king
They left David isolated in Hebron
questions.correctAnswer: They said, 'Behold, we are thy bone and thy flesh'
questions.explanation: Verse 1 depicts Israel affirming their unity with David, expressing covenantal solidarity and kinship, which echoes God's covenant promises in Genesis 17:7, Deuteronomy 7:9, Romans 11:17-24, and Ephesians 2:19-22.

questions.question: What does David's conquest of Jerusalem, despite the Jebusites' defiance, demonstrate about God's providence and human obedience?
options: David took the castle of Zion, showing God's enablement beyond human barriers
David abandoned the city when challenged
The Jebusites peacefully surrendered
David sought Saul's permission before attacking
questions.correctAnswer: David took the castle of Zion, showing God's enablement beyond human barriers
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 11:5 recounts David's victorious capture of the city despite Jebusite resistance, illustrating divine empowerment in human conquest, parallel to Joshua's conquest (Joshua 6), and God's promise to give enemies into His people's hands (Exodus 23:27-30, Psalm 44:3, Romans 8:28).

questions.question: Who was appointed chief and captain by David during the conquest of Jebus, highlighting leadership giftedness in God's people?
options: Joab the son of Zeruiah
Abishai the brother of Joab
Benaiah the son of Jehoiada
Eleazar the son of Dodo
questions.correctAnswer: Joab the son of Zeruiah
questions.explanation: According to 1 Chronicles 11:6, David declared the first to smite the Jebusites would be chief; Joab fulfilled this, showing God-given leadership roles within the community, consistent with God's ordination of leaders in Exodus 18:21, Judges 3:10, 1 Timothy 3:1-13, and Hebrews 13:7.

questions.question: What theological significance does the pouring out of water by David, which his mighty men brought from Bethlehem, represent?
options: David refused to drink the water, offering it to the LORD as a sacred act
David drank the water to celebrate victory
David discarded the water as unclean
David used the water to anoint himself king
questions.correctAnswer: David refused to drink the water, offering it to the LORD as a sacred act
questions.explanation: In 1 Chronicles 11:18-19, David pours out the water as an offering to God, recognizing the cost of his men's bravery and avoiding profaning their sacrifice, reflecting themes of sacred offerings in Leviticus 1:4, 2 Samuel 23:16-17, Hebrews 13:15, and Romans 12:1.

questions.question: Which of the mighty men is noted for slaying three hundred enemies with his spear at one time?
options: Jashobeam, an Hachmonite
Eleazar the son of Dodo
Abishai the brother of Joab
Benaiah the son of Jehoiada
questions.correctAnswer: Jashobeam, an Hachmonite
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 11:11 highlights Jashobeam's extraordinary valor, emphasizing God's empowerment of His servants for His purposes, paralleling Gideon's victory (Judges 7:22), David's battles (1 Samuel 18:7), and Christ's victory over sin (Colossians 2:15).

questions.question: What does the description of Eleazar holding his ground in the barley field during battle teach about faith and perseverance under trial?
options: Eleazar stood firm and delivered Israel despite others fleeing
Eleazar fled with the rest of the people
Eleazar negotiated peace with the Philistines
Eleazar hid in the city of David
questions.correctAnswer: Eleazar stood firm and delivered Israel despite others fleeing
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 11:13-14 recounts Eleazar's steadfastness in battle, reflecting the biblical virtue of faithfulness amid adversity as seen in Daniel 3:16-18, Hebrews 11:33-34, James 1:12, and Revelation 2:10.

questions.question: What role did Benaiah the son of Jehoiada play among David's mighty men, and what does this reveal about divine enablement?
options: He performed extraordinary feats and was set over David's guard
He was the chief of the three mightiest men
He was a lesser soldier with no notable deeds
He served as a prophet to David
questions.correctAnswer: He performed extraordinary feats and was set over David's guard
questions.explanation: Verses 22-25 describe Benaiah's heroic deeds and his appointment over the guard, illustrating God's gifting and leadership within His people, consistent with God's empowerment in Judges 6:12, 1 Samuel 16:18, Ephesians 4:11-13, and 2 Timothy 1:7.

questions.question: What is the significance of the title 'city of David' given to the castle David dwelt in?
options: It marks the beginning of Jerusalem as God's chosen city and David's royal seat
It was a derogatory term used by the Jebusites
It refers to a small village outside Hebron
It was a temporary military camp
questions.correctAnswer: It marks the beginning of Jerusalem as God's chosen city and David's royal seat
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 11:7 calls the castle the city of David, signifying the establishment of Jerusalem as the political and spiritual center, prefiguring God's dwelling with His people (2 Samuel 5:7, Psalm 48:2, Isaiah 2:3, Revelation 21:2).

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 11 describe the growth of David's kingdom and what theological truth does this convey?
options: David waxed greater and greater because the LORD of hosts was with him
David's kingdom diminished due to internal strife
David ruled only a small portion of Israel
David depended solely on his own strength
questions.correctAnswer: David waxed greater and greater because the LORD of hosts was with him
questions.explanation: Verse 9 shows that David's success is attributed to God's presence and favor, affirming the doctrine of divine providence and blessing, consistent with Psalm 18:35, Proverbs 21:31, Isaiah 41:10, and Philippians 4:13.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about Abishai according to 1 Chronicles 11?
options: He lifted up his spear against three hundred men and was chief of the three mightiest
He was the first to smite the Jebusites
He slew two lionlike men of Moab
He was set over David's guard
questions.correctAnswer: He lifted up his spear against three hundred men and was chief of the three mightiest
questions.explanation: Verses 20-21 describe Abishai's valor and leadership among David's top warriors, demonstrating God's empowerment for leadership and courage, paralleling Exodus 18:21, Judges 6:12, and 1 Timothy 3:2.

questions.question: What does the detailed listing of David's mighty men in 1 Chronicles 11 teach about the nature of God's kingdom community?
options: God's kingdom includes a diverse group of faithful servants from various tribes and backgrounds
Only the tribe of Judah supported David
David's army was composed solely of professional soldiers
The mighty men were all from one family
questions.correctAnswer: God's kingdom includes a diverse group of faithful servants from various tribes and backgrounds
questions.explanation: Verses 26-47 list men from multiple tribes, affirming the inclusive nature of God's covenant community, consistent with Galatians 3:28, Romans 12:4-5, Ephesians 2:19-22, and Revelation 7:9.

questions.question: What is the significance of David’s longing for water from the well of Bethlehem while in the hold, in light of Christological typology?
options: It prefigures Christ’s living water and the cost of salvation
It signifies David's thirst for physical refreshment only
It shows David’s lack of trust in God
It indicates David’s abandonment by his men
questions.correctAnswer: It prefigures Christ’s living water and the cost of salvation
questions.explanation: Verses 16-18 describe David’s desire for water that his men risked their lives to obtain, symbolizing Christ’s sacrificial provision of living water (John 4:10, John 7:38), and the costly nature of salvation (Isaiah 53:12, Hebrews 12:2).

questions.question: How does the account of David’s mighty men strengthening him relate to the biblical doctrine of the church as the body of Christ?
options: They represent faithful members who support the king, analogous to members supporting Christ
They were only interested in personal gain
They acted independently of David
They replaced the king’s authority
questions.correctAnswer: They represent faithful members who support the king, analogous to members supporting Christ
questions.explanation: Verse 10 describes the mighty men strengthening David, illustrating the concept of mutual support within God's people, corresponding to 1 Corinthians 12:12-27, Ephesians 4:15-16, Romans 12:4-5, and Hebrews 10:24-25.

questions.question: What does David’s covenant with the elders of Israel before the LORD signify about the nature of biblical leadership and community?
options: Leadership is established through covenant before God, emphasizing accountability and divine sanction
Leaders rule by popular vote without divine involvement
David seized power without consultation
The elders rejected David’s kingship
questions.correctAnswer: Leadership is established through covenant before God, emphasizing accountability and divine sanction
questions.explanation: Verse 3 shows a covenant made before the LORD, indicating leadership under divine authority and communal accountability, consistent with Joshua 24:15, 2 Samuel 5:3, Hebrews 13:17, and 1 Peter 5:2-3.
